title: Tension - ropes with uniform mass distribution

content.question: A uniform rope with nonnegligible mass is attached to a block in two different situations, as shown in the figures. In Situation <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the block is suspended from the ceiling and remains motionless. In Situation <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the rope can be modeled as completely horizontal. In which situation, if either, does the magnitude of the tension at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> equal the magnitude of the tension at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
